channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Loud noises on main road, 6th March
item.description:
Loud drain cover outside of Hindu community centre becoming a pot hole, every time a car drives over it it bangs. Damage is worsening over time, has been present for over 1 month.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62, Swindon Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes between start of road - no. 30, 6th March
item.description:
There are numerous large potholes stretching from the start of the road around the bend and up to number 30. Three examples attached but there are numerous others that should be reviewed at the same time. Potholes in the road have already been patched up several times before.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25;27, Salamanca Road, Oakley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enquiry Number: 22042747, 6th March
item.description:
Web Reference: 5661967 Enquiry Number: 22042747 Issue: Pothole on the Pavement Location: On the right hand side of pavement of Christchurch road when facing Christ Churchbetween Well Place and Malvern Road. This is a very busy pavement and is extremely dangerous as can be seen via the photos. Site: CHRISTCHURCH ROAD The repair has now been completed. Who-ever has reported back to you that this work has been completed is lying. I have just completed my walk past this area and there is no evidence of any work having taken place what so ever. The pavement is exactly as per the photos I filed with yourselves. Please ensure that the work order is reinstate and hopefully it shall be done this time – properly! This is a pavement that school children use every day to walk from their boarding houses to the main school and should not be left in such a poor condition.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Christchurch Road, Lansdown, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 large deep pothole near to bus stop near to Oakland house. These have been reported numerous times over the past 18 months, 6th March

Left hand side of road near bus stop heading towards shutdington/Churchdown
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Fence being put up on grass verge, 6th March
item.description:
Lower Farm Upper Coberley, GL53 9RD The owner of Lower Farm is putting up a fence along the grass verge to the road - as far as I am aware this is not her land, the boundary is her wall and grass is council owned land - please advise? The fence will stop cars from avoiding any oncoming traffic, dogs and dog walkers, horses and children as the owner of Lower Farm has already created a blind spot on a dangerous bend by growing foliage out into the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: You need to resurface 100yards of this road., 6th March

item.title: Path/Way misused by unlawful users problem, 6th March
item.description:
email rcvd 26.02.24 - I have been given a remit to carry out essential repair work to a Network Rail structure off Brockhampton lane, Swindon Village, GL50 4SL. The structure has a public footpath leading to it from Brockhampton lane but has a vehicle gate that is currently locked. I have been told by Tewkesbury council that this gate would probably be under gloucester highways control. Please could you help by pointing me in the right direction with regards to gaining vehicle access to the public right of way that is currently locked. Thank you in advance.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A week without light, 6th March
item.description:
Elmfield Avenue, Elmfield Road, and probably a couple more streets have been without any light for a week now. It's properly dark, and with the bad state of the roads and pavements, it's really dangerous and also scary, as it's pitch black.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3a, Elmfield Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 6th March
item.description:
26/02/24 FMS rcvd from Local council - Tree leaning out into above the hihgway - The tree appears to be leaning more over a short time (the last few weeks) This poses a potential hazard to both vehicles school busses, vans, and pedestrians etc using this road onto the estate. Oldbury Road is a busy road at certain times.
Report on FixMyStreet
